definitions: having a color that is partly gray with hints of other colors mixed in
examples: The sky had a grayish tint before the storm
She wore a grayish sweater that matched her eyes

definitions: having the surface scraped or worn away by rubbing against something rough
examples: His grazed knee needed cleaning after the fall
The grazed leather showed signs of heavy use

definitions: covered or lubricated with a thick oily substance to reduce friction
examples: The greased pan prevented the cake from sticking
The mechanic worked on the greased engine parts

definitions: covered with or containing too much oil or fat that feels slippery
having an unpleasant oily quality in appearance or manner
examples: The greasy dishes needed extra soap to clean
His greasy hair hadn't been washed in days
The salesman had a greasy smile that made customers uncomfortable
She avoided the greasy diner on the corner

definitions: of a larger size, amount, or degree compared to something else
having more importance, influence, or significance than others
examples: The greater portion of students passed the exam
We need greater effort to achieve our goals
She played a greater role in the project's success
The greater good must be considered in decisions

definitions: of the largest size, amount, or degree possible or recorded
of the highest quality, importance, or achievement in a category
examples: Mount Everest has the greatest height of all mountains
The greatest number of votes determines the winner
She was considered the greatest athlete of her generation
This is the greatest movie I've ever seen

definitions: having an intense and selfish desire for more than one needs
unwilling to share possessions or resources with others who need them
examples: The greedy child grabbed all the candy for himself
Greedy investors caused the market to crash
Don't be greedy with your time when others need help
The greedy corporation hoarded essential supplies

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a glass structure for growing plants
examples: The greenhouse effect is warming our planet dangerously
They installed greenhouse panels to extend the growing season

definitions: having a color that is partly green with other colors mixed in
examples: The old copper had a greenish patina on its surface
She felt sick and her face looked greenish

definitions: enjoying the company of others and seeking social interaction frequently and enthusiastically
examples: Her gregarious personality made her popular at parties
Gregarious animals like dolphins travel in large groups

definitions: having a color that is a neutral shade between black and white
lacking brightness or interest and creating a depressing atmosphere
examples: The grey clouds threatened rain all afternoon
She painted the walls a soft grey color
It was a grey day with nothing exciting happening
His grey mood affected everyone around him

definitions: having a color that is partly grey with hints of other colors
examples: The greyish dawn slowly brightened into morning
His beard had turned greyish with age

definitions: feeling intense sorrow, especially due to someone's death or a significant loss
examples: The grieving family needed time to heal after their loss
Grieving students gathered to remember their teacher

definitions: causing great pain, suffering, or sorrow to those who experience it
very serious or severe in nature requiring immediate attention or action
examples: The accident caused grievous injuries to several passengers
They made a grievous error in their calculations
The grievous nature of the crime shocked the community
It would be a grievous mistake to ignore the warning

definitions: cooked on a metal grate over direct heat from below
subjected to intense and persistent questioning or interrogation
examples: The grilled vegetables were perfectly charred and tender
We ordered grilled chicken sandwiches for lunch
The suspect was grilled by detectives for hours
The committee grilled the candidate about her experience

definitions: having a forbidding or harsh appearance that suggests difficulty ahead
very serious or gloomy in character suggesting unpleasant outcomes
examples: The grim fortress loomed over the valley below
His grim expression warned us not to joke
The doctor delivered grim news about the test results
They faced grim prospects for survival in winter

definitions: holding one's attention completely through excitement, tension, or compelling interest
examples: The gripping novel kept me awake all night reading
She told a gripping story about her mountain rescue

definitions: causing horror or disgust through being gruesome or involving violence and death
examples: The grisly crime scene disturbed even veteran detectives
They discovered grisly evidence in the abandoned warehouse

definitions: containing or covered with small particles of sand or stone
showing courage and resolve in facing difficult or unpleasant situations
examples: The gritty sand got into our shoes at the beach
The gritty texture of the cleaner helped remove stains
Her gritty determination helped her overcome every obstacle
The movie portrayed the gritty reality of urban life

definitions: having hair that is gray or partly gray, especially from age
examples: The grizzled veteran shared stories from his military service
His grizzled beard gave him a distinguished appearance

definitions: having a gray or partly gray color, especially in hair or fur
examples: The grizzly bear's fur was thick and protective
His grizzly appearance made him look older than his years

definitions: having a neat and clean appearance through careful attention to details
carefully prepared or trained for a particular position or purpose
examples: The well groomed executive made a professional impression
Her groomed appearance showed attention to detail
He was being groomed for the company presidency
The groomed candidate had all the right qualifications

definitions: marked with long narrow channels or depressions cut into a surface
examples: The grooved surface provided better grip for climbing
Ancient grooved stones were used for grinding grain

definitions: fashionably attractive or exciting in a retro or dated way
having grooves or channels cut into the surface
examples: That's a groovy shirt from the seventies era
The band played groovy music that got everyone dancing
The groovy texture helped the parts fit together
The groovy pattern improved the tire's traction

definitions: searching blindly or uncertainly with the hands to find something
moving or proceeding uncertainly without clear direction or understanding
examples: He was groping for the light switch in darkness
Her groping attempts to explain confused everyone
The groping efforts to solve the crisis were ineffective
They made groping progress toward a solution

definitions: comically or repulsively ugly or distorted in shape or appearance
examples: The grotesque gargoyles decorated the cathedral's exterior
His face was twisted into a grotesque expression

definitions: irritable and bad-tempered, especially in a habitual way
examples: The grouchy old man complained about the noise constantly
She gets grouchy when she hasn't eaten lunch

definitions: introducing new ideas or methods that have never been used before
examples: Her groundbreaking research changed our understanding of genetics
The groundbreaking ceremony marked the start of construction

definitions: not based on any good reason or evidence and therefore unjustified
examples: Their groundless accusations damaged his reputation unfairly
Her fears proved to be completely groundless

definitions: arranged or organized together in categories or clusters based on similarities
examples: The grouped data made the patterns easier to analyze
Students were grouped according to their skill levels

definitions: having reached full size or maturity through natural development
produced or cultivated through farming or gardening practices
examples: The grown children had families of their own
A grown man should know better than that
These locally grown vegetables taste fresher than imported ones
The grown crops were ready for harvest

definitions: extremely tiring and demanding great effort and endurance over time
examples: The grueling marathon tested every runner's limits
She endured a grueling workout schedule

definitions: extremely tiring and demanding great effort and endurance over time
examples: The gruelling expedition lasted for three months
They faced a gruelling series of examinations

definitions: causing horror and revulsion through being shockingly brutal or disgusting
examples: The gruesome accident scene required counseling for witnesses
They discovered gruesome details about the crime

definitions: rough and low in pitch when speaking, often seeming unfriendly
examples: His gruff voice scared the children at first
Despite his gruff manner, he was actually very kind

definitions: bad-tempered and sulky, showing annoyance through complaining or being uncooperative
examples: The grumpy cat hissed at everyone who approached
Don't be so grumpy about waking up early

definitions: cautious and having possible reservations about revealing information or feelings
protected or watched over by security personnel or measures
examples: She gave a guarded response to the personal question
His guarded optimism reflected past disappointments
The guarded facility housed sensitive government documents
Heavily guarded convoys transported the valuable cargo

definitions: relating to or characteristic of a state governor or the office
examples: The gubernatorial election attracted national media attention
Several gubernatorial candidates debated tax reform policies

definitions: directed or led by someone with knowledge or experience
having guidance or assistance provided for navigation or understanding
examples: The guided tour explained the museum's history
Guided meditation helped reduce her stress levels
The guided missile system increased accuracy significantly
Students followed guided instructions for the experiment

definitions: providing direction, advice, or influence that helps others make decisions
examples: Her guiding principle was to always tell the truth
The guiding light led ships safely to harbor

definitions: easily deceived or tricked because of being too trusting of others
examples: The gullible tourist bought fake designer bags
Don't be so gullible about internet scams

definitions: sticky or adhesive in texture like chewing gum or glue
having no teeth, especially referring to babies or elderly people
examples: The gummy candy stuck to his dental work
The gummy residue was hard to remove
The baby's gummy smile melted everyone's hearts
His gummy grin showed he'd lost his dentures

definitions: flowing out rapidly and in large quantities with force
expressing excessive enthusiasm or emotion in an unrestrained way
examples: Gushing water burst from the broken pipe
The gushing fountain created a spectacular display
Her gushing praise made everyone feel uncomfortable
The critic's gushing review seemed over the top

definitions: characterized by strong and sudden bursts of wind blowing intermittently
examples: The gusty weather made sailing difficult and dangerous
Gusty conditions knocked over several trash cans

definitions: showing courage, determination, and spirit in facing challenges or risks
examples: Her gutsy performance impressed all the talent judges
It was a gutsy move to start his own business

definitions: harsh-sounding and produced in the throat with a rough quality
examples: His guttural voice was perfect for heavy metal singing
The guttural sounds of the language were hard to pronounce

definitions: relating to or involving exercises requiring physical strength, flexibility, and coordination
examples: Her gymnastic abilities won her three gold medals
The gymnastic routine required years of training

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine dealing with women's reproductive health
examples: She scheduled a gynaecological examination for next week
The gynaecological clinic specialized in fertility treatments

definitions: relating to the branch of medicine dealing with women's reproductive health
examples: The gynecological ward was staffed by specialist nurses
Regular gynecological checkups are important for women's health

definitions: relating to or using a device that spins to maintain orientation
examples: The gyroscopic stabilizer kept the camera steady
Gyroscopic forces help bicycles stay upright when moving
